description: home of the Hispanist Lord Holland, and a centre for Whig political, social and cultural life
commentary: Mackintosh has brought back from India a diseased liver, & a reputation which I do not think he will be able to support either in Parliament, or in his xx intended historical labours. I met him at Holland House, & at Madam de Staels.

description: Bull and Mouth, an inn from which coaches and wagons left for Cumbria
commentary: Before my departure I dined with Gooch. Aldermanbury being conveniently near the Bull & Mouth.

description: Home from 1810 of Southey’s uncle Herbert Hill, his wife and children. Southey and his family were frequent visitors when in London.
commentary: I was sorry to leave Streatham, & think the more seriously of moving southward because I liked <it> so well.
[Arrived at noon] crossed over at once into the city

description: From London Bridge Station, via King William St, one block

commentary: dinner at a chop-house in the Poultery
Passed St. Paul's to the Strand
To find our house. They referred us elsewhere, being full.
Secured rooms at last. . . . Very cheap.
Went down to Queen's Hotel to inquire about our ship friends.

description: Popular name of Theatre Royal in Catherine St east of Covent Garden, a 2-mile walk from Queen Hotel.
observed: a great crowd, & fine music [...] at Julien's Promenade Concerts
commentary: Went to Drury Lane  [Ed. Louis Antoine Jullien (1812-60) held his "concerts d'hiver" at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane.]

observed: Bentley's Miscellany' with something about Redburn [...] also saw Blackwood's long story about a short book

commentary: in the Strand [Ed. Location conjectural (WK). Image of the American Bowling Saloon from PENNY ILLUSTRATED NEWS, 1849.]

description: home of the Hispanist Lord Holland, and a centre for Whig political, social and cultural life
Bull and Mouth, an inn from which coaches and wagons left for Cumbria
commentary: A parcel sent from the Bull & Mouth reaches Keswick in ten days; – others have often been from three to five weeks.

description: Popular name of Theatre Royal in Catherine St east of Covent Garden, a 2-mile walk from Queen Hotel.

commentary: I went to Murray, & convinced him that the character of the Review was at stake. [Ed. A controversy over a review by Southey in the Quarterly Review.]
source: Robert Southey to Charles Watkin Williams Wynn

place: Queen Anne Street, Cavendish Square, London
description: Home of Henry Herbert Southey, used by Robert Southey during his stays in London
commentary: Coleridge dined here yesterday, in good health & spirits.
